problem_text:
19.67. Let G ⩽ Sym(Ω), where Ω is finite. The 2-closure G(2) of the group G is defined to be the largest subgroup of Sym(Ω) containing G which has the same orbits as G in the induced action on Ω × Ω. Is it true that if G is solvable, then every composition factor of G(2) is either a cyclic or an alternating group?
I. Ponomarenko
answer: No, it is not true (S. V. Skresanov, Algebra Logic, 58, no. 3 (2019), 249–253).
